Akira Kurosawa's THRONE OF BLOOD

Description: (Japan, 1957) Director: Akira Kurosawa. Screenplay by Akira Kurosawa and Shinobu Hashimoto, based on William Shakespeare's Macbeth. Cast: Toshiro Mifune, Isuzu Yamada, Takashi Shimura, Chieko Naniwa.

With the highlands of 11th century Scotland transported to a fog-drenched castle on Mt. Fuji in feudal Japan - and an eerie spirit woman standing in for the three witches - Throne of Blood is Kurosawa's brilliant re-imaging of Shakespeare's Macbeth. Toshire Mifune plays a Samurai warrior whose restless ambition leads him to violence and despair, and Isuzu Yamada gives a haunting performance as the samurai's manipulative wife who is complicit in his murderous rise to power. Kurosawa's iconic image of his tragic hero's spectacular rendezvous with fate is one of the most visually stunning final scenes in movie history. "A dark, unique masterpiece! Richly visual, it is as much an original work as an adaptation."- Elliott Stein, The Village Voice

108 min.
